name: Roland Vance
text: with the professional services we've enjoyed

name: Deon Benson
text: They are really helpful

name: David Edward Jr.
text: So this guy Dale works here and parks in what is clearly not a spot. It blocks the traffic in the parking lot causing cars to execute a 20-point turn to turn around. I've asked him and his manager if he would please not park like that...He continues to do what he wants. He really is just an A-Hole. Please, someone leave some nails or screws in his parking spot for him!

name: John Miller
text: I have had the pleasure of working with staff here on several occasions: Donna, Kim, Summer, and Michele are wonderful to work with. They have placed several ads and articles for our church and have gone out of their way to ensure everything is just right.

name: Don Franks
text: Subscribed ($25) to Souteast Sun in Enterprise. It was left on my lawn until about 2 months ago when it stopped. I have sent an email to customer service but to no avail. I still don't get the paper.Would like to know if any others have had this experience.

resp.text: Mr Franks, I was working on My Google search and found these reviews. I know it has been awhile, but if you could take a minute and tell me a few things I would appreciate it. What customer service email did you use? Are you still experiencing problems receiving the paper? What is you address? Anytime you have a problem with delivery, please call our phone number to let us know at (334) 393-2969. Thank you for subscribing and we do appreciate your readership. Russell Quattlebaum, Co-Publisher

name: Cecelia Dismukes
text: We have a delivery problem that is on going. Getting in touch with anyone at the paper is impossible. My husband held the phone for over two hours without talking to anyone. In the past week and a half we have not gotten a paper 3 times. Hardly a week goes by that we get a paper every day . Too bad we have so few options when it comes to news papers.

name: Chelle Ham
text: I went in for an interview and the building is so outdated. The reception area is unwelcoming and desperately needs to be renovated and redecorated. It was not a great first impression of the Dothan Eagle. The staff was kind. But the offices could use some investing in.

Because we do want a home delivery newspaper, we forgave them on their mistake and signed on again for a paid subscription. Now they have our money and still no newspapers. I hate to event give a single star for a service that doesn’t exist.

name: me to you
text: It seems after researching why obituaries vary in length,  the only reason is that you have to pay for the obituary.   Most are 2 or 3 sentences because of the cost. Now we know. It would help if there was a note that stated obituaries are paid for by the family and are not free.

name: Hailey Smith
text: The times journal is great!!😉

name: Rosemary Davidson
text: I started my subscription to the Huntsville Times after the tornados swept through the Valley, blacking our power & communication for over a week. The Times delivered to everyone possible and was the only means of news after cell phones die and electricity is unavailable. My delivery driver is awesome, braving ice and tornadoes to get the news out. She puts a postcard in the paper so I can call her directly if my paper is wet or missing, which very rarely happens. Thank you for providing such a needed service.

name: Randall
text: Do not subscribe to the Huntsville times. They will never deliver your paper, even after you call customer service. If you can actually get through to customer service, that is.

name: Chintan Patel
text: Wonderful job. You are working so good for the community by publishing everyday news for our county and area.
